comment: Dr. Vaezi was fantastic in explaining technical concepts to non-technical people. It is obvious that he cares about his students and wants them to succeed both in his class and in life.

This guy is everything you want in a professor if you genuinely want to learn some cool stuff. If you are not a techy person, learning the data mining software may intimidate you and will take time. There is a substantial amount of work that WILL get confusing but he is very easy to talk to and meet with if you need to.

I'll be honest, this class is tough! YOU WILL HAVE TO STUDY. Make sure you're fully prepared to devote the time. However, he is an easy grader. You need to read the book, his quizzes and exams will be difficult, because he questions on your ability to understand conceptual context. His exams are based on the questions asked on the quiz! STUDY
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Group projects

comment: This course covers a LOT for 7 weeks. However, if you put in the work -- you'll do fine. Prof Vaezi is a quick grader, he responds quickly, and he is fair. Don't take this course if you don't have the time to dedicate to it for the full 7 weeks. But if you show up, ask questions, and put in the work, you'll do well. (It is not an easy A, though).

So much information was crammed into the course. Every assignment is basically a project. His expectations were not clear. All test and assignments are based off of your interpretations of what he wants. When you ask for guidance he points you to his powerpoints where you have to interpret the meaning of what he is saying. I do not recommend him.

Dr.Reza is "The Best" professor I have ever worked with. He appears to be difficult and weird at times but every single word he utters has a deep meaning in it. He is awesome and very responsible. I would definitely want to get my PhD from his hands. He is an intellect. He responds to all the communication on time. He is a Genius and Brilliant Prof
stay on his good side or he will come up with any reason just to fail you. just dont take his course honestly. theres better professors out there.

Weekly Java coding projects that he provided little guidance on and no resources on. It takes more time figuring out what he wants and then looking online for resources than the actual project as he refuses to give any resources or clear instructions. He was communicative outside of class but only really said "figure it out" to everything.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things--Group projects

comment: Dr. Vaezi was an excellent professor. He is quite knowledgeable, sets clear expectations, and is very articulate. Be sure to take advantage of his optional philosophical discussions at the end of class - you wont regret it.

Class was mediocre. There was a quiz at the start of each test and after it was complete the professor would regurgitate the same slides you studied. Not much learning at all.  Also, he is lenient with assignments but focuses more on how he wants the submission to look rather than the actual content itself.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Avoid this professor, he is just awful!
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Mandatory attendance and participation. I liked this professor and he is very knowledgeable about the subject, when he is running the class. Technically have 2 group projects if you count the day your group teaches the class. Easy to understand, clear with instructions and grades assignments quickly. Open book Tests and quizzes!!!!

Great professor! He's quick to respond to e-mails. I was nervous about taking this online, but it's been a breeze. Do the assignments/discussions exactly how he instructs & you'll get an A! Each module has a quiz or 2 & you only have a midterm & final. The only thing that sucks is the group project. Find a group ASAP or you risk getting a 0 on it.
Awesome professor, easy grader do your work and follow his instructions easy to make A.

One thing to know, he cares more about all assignmentsdiscussions done exactly the way he wants it rather than making it look nice and creative. There is one group assignment which is annoying, and two exams (Mid-termFinal) exams look just like the quizzes. There are weekly quizzes that are not hard at all, he gives you 3 attempts to get a 100.
